abstract: Though reliant on advertising revenue, the Internet giant is reiterating its commitment to transparency and open industry standards.
snippet: Though reliant on advertising revenue, the Internet giant is reiterating its commitment to transparency and open industry standards.
lead_paragraph: IN a manifestolike e-mail message sent last month to all Google employees, Jonathan Rosenberg, a senior vice president for product management, told them to commit to greater transparency and open industry standards. Rather than hoard knowledge to exploit it, he wrote in “The Meaning of Open,” share it and watch Google and the entire Internet prosper.

headline.main: In Allowing Ad Blockers, a Test for Google
headline.print_headline: In Ad Blockers, a Test for Google

abstract: SpinVox was sold to Nuance Communications for $102.5 million, far less than the company was thought to be worth in recent years.
snippet: SpinVox was sold to Nuance Communications for $102.5 million, far less than the company was thought to be worth in recent years.
lead_paragraph: SpinVox, a former high-flying British start-up that developed a system for converting telephone voice-mail messages to text, has been sold to an American software provider for less than a quarter of the valuation it once commanded.

headline.main: Nuance Communications Buys SpinVox, Which Converts Voice Mail to Text
headline.print_headline: A British Company That Converts Voice Mail to Text Is Bought

abstract: While the recession may be ending across much of the world, its effect on revenue collectors and corporate tax returns will last much longer.
snippet: While the recession may be ending across much of the world, its effect on revenue collectors and corporate tax returns will last much longer.
lead_paragraph: While the recession may be ending across much of the world, its effect on revenue collectors and corporate tax returns will last much longer.

headline.main: Corporate Tax Returns Face Heavier Scrutiny
